Html:
I get the message "The Default Data Path is configured for a drive (E:) that currently holds database files of another type. This may result in multiple file types on the same drive when new databases are created which can negatively impact performance." as a performance alert in the database engine assesment.
This is due to the use of mountend volumes.
Is there a solution for this issue ?

Thanks.

Mountpoints has been on my to-do list for a while now. I've got some ideas, hope to tackle it in the next 1-2 months with a new release that adds support for SQL 2016, too.

--Kendal
